Metadata: Clavaspirin, an antibacterial and haemolytic peptide from "Styela clava"

Researchers cloned the precursor of a novel peptide from pharyngeal tissues of the tunicate, "Styela clava." Its sequence predicted a histidine-rich, amidated 23-residue peptide that the authors named clavaspirin. This report describes the antimicrobial and other properties of clavaspirin.
